choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
For libreoffice calc write an expression to copy contents from another cell and remove all single quotes

### Response:


To copy the contents of a cell and remove all single quotes, you can use the following formula in LibreOffice Calc:

`=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")`

where `A1` is the cell that contains the text you want to modify. 

This formula uses the SUBSTITUTE function to replace all occurrences of single quotes with an empty string. The result will be a cell that contains the contents of the original cell, but without any single quotes.
